articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia on Monday evacuated parts of another region next to Ukraine after Kyiv sharply increased military activity near the border just days after its biggest incursion into sovereign Russian territory since the start of the 2022 war.
articles.title: Russia evacuates another border region amid growing threat from Ukrainian units

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. expects Gaza peace talks to move forward as planned, the State Department said on Monday, adding it believes a ceasefire deal remains possible even after Hamas cast doubt on whether it would participate in a Thursday meeting called by mediators.
articles.title: US says it expects Gaza peace talks to continue, ceasefire possible

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's top commander said on Monday Kyiv controlled around 1,000 square kilometers of Russia's Kursk region, his first public comments since Ukraine launched its biggest cross-border attack in almost 2-1/2 years of full-scale war.
articles.title: Ukraine says it controls 1,000 square km of Russia's Kursk region

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch, Wa Lone, Jorge Garcia
articles.description: As a physician specializing in addiction, Dr. Jasmeet Bains, the first Sikh American elected to the California assembly, was used to risky situations.
articles.title: Sikh activists in US, Canada face threats a year after Trudeau linked leader's killing to India

articles.author: Jehad Shalbak Amr Alfiky
articles.description: Displaced in south Lebanon five times, Kamel Mroue and his wife Mariam are anxious about their next move as they follow the news of clashes between Israel and Hezbollah, fearing border hostilities will turn into all-out war.
articles.title: Lebanon’s displaced fear a bleak future

articles.author: Richard Cowan, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk is due to interview Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on the X social media network on Monday in an event that could inject more surprises into the turbulent U.S. presidential election.
articles.title: Elon Musk to interview Trump on X social media network

articles.author: Pietro Lombardi
articles.description: More than 47,000 people died in Europe due to scorching temperatures in 2023, with countries in the region's south hit the hardest, according to a report by the Barcelona Institute for Global Health (ISGlobal) published on Monday.
articles.title: More than 47,000 people died in Europe last year due to heat, report says

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: A Muslim advocacy group filed a lawsuit on Monday against the FBI and leaders of other U.S. government agencies over what it called the discriminatory and racist placement of two Palestinian Americans on a watch list.
articles.title: US government sued over alleged discrimination against Palestinian Americans

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Joe Biden's administration has not made an offer of amnesty to Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro to shield him from criminal prosecution in the United States in exchange for him giving up power since the South American country's July 28 election, the White House said on Monday.
articles.title: US says it has not offered Maduro amnesty since election

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: South Korea and the United States will begin annual summertime military drills next week to ramp up their capability to counter North Korea's weapons and cyber threats, officials said on Monday.
articles.title: South Korea, US to stage annual drills over North's missile, cyber threats
